task_summary: Place down the red cube onto the table and retreat safely.

task_long_description.overview: A 6-DoF arm holds a small red cube above a white tabletop populated by other objects (green bottle, blue can, orange cylinders, small gray block). The goal is to place the red cube down gently on the table surface near the central clear area, avoiding collisions and then retreating. The behavior emphasizes controlled approach, contact-aware lowering, opening the gripper to release, and backing away to clear the workspace.
preconditions: Red cube is grasped in the gripper
Table surface is clear at target spot
stepwise_plan: Verify the cube is in the gripper.
Move to a pose above the table placement spot.
Lower slowly until surface contact is detected.
Open the gripper to release the cube.
Retreat a short distance to clear the object.
success_criteria: Red cube rests stably on the tabletop
End-effector retreats to a safe distance
failure_and_recovery: If contact is not detected within max depth, stop and retry approach.
If object slips before release, re-grasp and repeat placement.
If excessive force is detected, abort lowering and choose a new spot.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the cube is placed, gripper opened, and arm has retreated and waited briefly.

frame_3.now_evidence: Gripper centered above the target with the red cube aligned; onset of lowering is visible.
frame_3.predicts_next: Contact and release expected next as the wrist descends.

node_specs.description: Checks that the red cube is currently held.
Move to a pose above the table placement spot with vertical offset.
Descend slowly until surface contact is detected or limits reached.
Release the cube by opening the gripper.
Back away to clear the placed object.

failure_modes: Cube sticks to fingers after opening
recovery_strategy: Retry approach with a slightly higher offset
Open wider and lightly oscillate before retreat
Select a new placement spot and re-attempt
assumptions: Frames indicate the gripper holding a red object consistent with a cube; we treat it as 'red_cube'.
Placement area is the central tabletop; represented as target 'place_on_table' and area 'table'.
No explicit speed/precision adjectives in the instruction; default bins chosen.

expected_success_criteria: Cube visible on table after OpenGripper
No contact alarms > force_threshold during placement
